docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Technical Documentation for Project Data
docs.text: This document provides a technical overview of specific sections within project_data.xml. The highlighted sections include the Video Menu, Points of Interest (POIs), Videos, and the initial line of krpano code.

docs.title: 1. krpano Beginning Line of Code:
docs.text:
• floor_height: Specifies the height of the floor, set to 160.
  • map_angle: Defines the angle of the map, set to 0.
  • debugkeys: A boolean value to enable or disable debug keys, set to false.
  • debugmode: A boolean value to enable or disable debug mode, set to true.

docs.title: 2. Video Menu:
docs.text: The Video Menu section within the XML snippet contains a list of video links categorized under various headings like "Tower Videos", "Core Response Procedures", "Emergency Scenarios", and "Catalog Videos". Each video link is associated with a data-url attribute which likely refers to the video source or identifier.

docs.title: 3. Points Of Interest (POIs):
docs.text: The Points of Interest (POIs) section within the XML snippet defines several data items each associated with a type and a text description. The types include "placard" and "video", and each data item has a name and content that describes a specific point of interest or provides additional information regarding it.

docs.title: 4. Videos:
docs.text: The Videos section within the XML snippet defines multiple data items each associated with a name and a stream attribute. The content of each data item appears to be a list of source links for streaming videos. Each video is categorized under either "Tower" or "Catalog", and is further associated with a specific emergency scenario or procedure.
